Requirement: External Sharing Options for Primary Calendars SHALL be configured to "Only free/busy information (hide event details)."
Details:
The following OUs are non-compliant: 
- Cool Example Org (group "Jesse Reynolds's group"): External sharing options for primary calendars is set to: Share all information, and allow managing of calendars

Requirement: Phishing-Resistant MFA SHALL be required for all users.
Details:
The following OUs are non-compliant: 
- 2SV Exempt: Allowed 2-step verification (2SV) method is set to "Any". 
- Alicia Williams's OU: 2-step verification (2SV) is not enforced. 
- Cool Example Org: Allowed 2-step verification (2SV) method is set to "Any". 
- Cool Example Org (group "James Harris's group"): Allowed 2-step verification (2SV) method is set to "Any". 
- Yvette Wright's OU (in Alicia Williams's OU): Allowed 2-step verification (2SV) method is set to "Any except verification codes via text, phone call". 
- Joshua Green's OU: Users cannot enable 2-step verification (2SV). 
- Patricia Johnson's OU (test): Allowed 2-step verification (2SV) method is set to "Any".

Requirement: If phishing-resistant MFA has not been enforced, an alternative MFA method SHALL be enforced for all users.
Details:
The following OUs are non-compliant: 
- 2SV Exempt: 2-step verification (2SV) is not enforced. 
- Zachary Moore's OU: 2-step verification (2SV) is not enforced. 
- Aaron Jackson's OU: Users cannot enable 2-step verification (2SV).

Requirement: SMS or Voice as the MFA method SHALL NOT be used.
Details:
The following OUs are non-compliant: 
- 2SV Exempt: Verification codes via text and phone call allowed. 
- Charles Wright's OU: 2-step verification (2SV) is not enforced. 
- Cool Example Org: Verification codes via text and phone call allowed. 
- Cool Example Org (group "Michael Howard's group"): Verification codes via text and phone call allowed. 
- Jerome Warren's OU: Users cannot enable 2-step verification (2SV). 
- Whitney Jones's OU (test): Verification codes via text and phone call allowed.

Requirement: Google 2SV new user enrollment period SHALL be set to at least 1 day or at most 1 week.
Details:
The following OUs are non-compliant: 
- 2SV Exempt: New user enrollment period is NONE 
- Cool Example Org (group "Jody Johnson's group"): New user enrollment period is NONE 
- Paul Smith's OU: New user enrollment period 14 days (longer than 7 days)

- Cool Example Org (group "Leslie Duke's group"): User is allowed to trust device. 
- Sarah Garcia's OU (in Kelly Holland's OU): User is allowed to trust device. 
- James Rodriguez's OU (test): User is allowed to trust device.

Requirement: Users SHALL be forced to re-authenticate after an established 12-hour GWS login session has expired.

The following OUs are non-compliant:

Requirement: User password length SHALL be at least 12 characters.
Details:
The following OUs are non-compliant:

- Cool Example Org: Enforce password policy at next sign-in is OFF 
- Travis Love MD's OU: Enforce password policy at next sign-in is OFF

Requirement: User passwords SHALL NOT be reused.

Requirement: User passwords SHALL NOT expire.
Details:
The following OUs are non-compliant:

Requirement: Account self-recovery for users and non-Michael Anderson's OU SHALL be disabled.
Details:
The following OUs are non-compliant: 
- Cool Example Org: Users and non-Jeremy May's OU are allowed to recover their accounts.

Requirement: Agencies SHALL NOT allow users to consent to access to low-risk scopes.
Details:
The following services allow access: CALENDAR.

Warning: log-based check. See documentation in ScubaGoggles GitHub repository for limitations.

Requirement: Agencies SHALL NOT allow users to access unconfigured third-party apps.
Details:
The following OUs are non-compliant: 
- Gregory Moreno's OU: Unconfigured third-party app access is set to Allow users to access third-party apps that only request basic info needed for Sign in with Google. Warning: log-based check. See documentation in ScubaGoggles GitHub repository for limitations.

Requirement: Only approved Google Workspace Marketplace applications SHALL be allowed for installation.
Details:
The following OUs are non-compliant: 
- Cool Example Org: Users can install and run any internal app, even if it's not allowlisted.

Requirement: Google Takeout services SHALL be disabled.
Details:
The following OUs are non-compliant: 
- Joy Whitney's OU: The following apps with individual admin control have Takeout enabled: YouTube 
- Cool Example Org: Takeout is enabled for services without an individual admin control. 
- Cool Example Org: The following apps with individual admin control have Takeout enabled: Blogger, Google Books

Requirement: Require multi party approval for sensitive admin actions SHALL be enabled.
Details:
The following OUs are non-compliant: 
- Cool Example Org: Require multi party approval for sensitive admin actions is DISABLED Warning: log-based check. See documentation in ScubaGoggles GitHub repository for limitations.

Requirement: Agencies SHALL disable making files and published web content visible to anyone with the link.
Details:
The following OUs are non-compliant: 
- Cool Example Org: Published web content can be made visible to anyone with a link

Requirement: Agencies SHALL set access checking to recipients only.
Details:
The following OUs are non-compliant: 
- Misty Franklin's OU: Access Checker allows users to share files to recipients only, suggested target audience, or public (no Google account required) 
- Cool Example Org: Access Checker allows users to share files to recipients only, suggested target audience, or public (no Google account required)

Requirement: Agencies SHALL set newly created items to have Private to the Owner as the default level of access.
Details:
The following OUs are non-compliant: 
- Sean Green's OU: When users create items, the default access is set to: the primary target audience can search and find the item.

Requirement: Agencies SHALL NOT allow viewers and commenters to download, print, and copy files.
Details:
The following OUs are non-compliant: 
- Brian Marshall's OU: Viewers and commenters are allowed to download, print, and copy files.

Requirement: An SPF policy SHALL be published for each domain that fails all non-approved senders.
Details: 2 of 2 agency domain(s) found in violation: example.org, fisher.com.

Requirement: A DMARC policy SHALL be published for every second-level domain.
Details: 1 of 2 agency domain(s) found in violation: example.org.

Requirement: The DMARC message rejection option SHALL be p=reject.
Details: 1 of 2 agency domain(s) found in violation: example.org.

Requirement: The DMARC point of contact for aggregate reports SHALL include `reports@dmarc.cyber.dhs.gov`.
Details: 1 of 2 agency domain(s) found in violation: example.org.

Requirement: Emails flagged by the above spoofing and authentication controls SHALL NOT be kept in inbox.
Details:

- Cool Example Org: domain, domain name, employee name, groups, unauthenticated spoof emails not removed from inbox
